titles.title: Amending the Rules of the House of Representatives to limit election expenditures by candidates for the House of Representatives.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Rules.

bill.summary: 5/11/1993--Introduced. Limits expenditures of a candidate for the House of Representatives to $600,000 with respect to any primary election or general election. Prohibits more than 40 percent of each such amount from being derived from contributions by multicandidate political committees and separate segregated funds. Provides that any Member found in violation of this Act by the House shall be guilty of disorderly behavior and subject to appropriate disciplinary action, including, censure and denial of committee assignment, use of the frank and stationery allowance, or office space.
